results.title: The Little black box = Hei xia die xue ji = 黑匣喋血记
results.creator_credit: Shanghai Film Studio and Zhong Shuhuang
results.brief_description:
On the eve of the 1911 Xinhai Revolution, Jinbiao, a Kungfu master, was selected to bring back a confidential document from Guangzhou. Jinbiao got the document in a little black box from another Kungfu master, Nan. Shortly after Jinbiao left, the government soldiers came to Nan’s house. Nan was killed and his dauguhter, Guiying and nephew, Jianxiong escaped. On his way back to Wuhan, Jinbiao was tailed and attacked by a masked person. In Changsha, Jinbiao sought help from Nan’s friend, Liu. But Jianxiong also came, telling everybody that Nan was killed and he lost touch with Guiying. Since Jinbiao and Jianxiong came to Liu’s house, a series incidents happened with one of Liu’s apprentice killed. Liu suspected Jinbiao and wanted to kill him. While Jinbiao was in touble, Guiying came and tried to convince Liu that Jinbiao was innocent. Later, Liu found out that Jianxiong was a spy of the Qing government, who plotted all the killing. In the end, Jianxiong was killed, but both Liu and Guiying also died in the fight with Jianxiong and the government soldiers in order to save Jinbiao, who eventually accomplished the mission. The Xinhai Revolution was the overthrow of China’s ruling Qing Dynasty in the early 1910s.

Martial arts film became a popular genre in Chinese cinema after The Shaolin Temple (1982) became a huge success in the early 1980s. Since the mid-1980s, the Chinese film industry went through a series of structural transformations aimed at marketization. In 1984, film was redefined to be an integral part of cultural industries instead of political institutions for the enforcement of Communist ideology. As a result, film studios began to produce more market-oriented films. This martial arts film reflected such a trend. This film combines elements of different genres such as martial arts and suspense. (3 stars - Yuxing Zhou; December 16, 2010)

results.title: The Little ark
results.creator_credit: Cinema Center Films, Robert B Radnitz and James B. Clark
results.brief_description: Two children in Holland, Jan Brink and Adinda de la Maison are orphaned after they are separated from their parents when a flood washes away their town. They are picked up by an Urker sea captain, along with the pets they have salvaged from the flood; a cat, rabbit, rooster and a dog. The captain proves to be a captivating story teller with the ability to teach values such as love and respect through his stories. Starring Monica Achterberg, Genevieve Ambas, Philip Frame and Theodore Bikel as the captain. Filmed entirely in Holland and based on the novel by Jan De Hartog.

results.title: The Little airplane that grew
results.creator_credit: Pierre Rihouet and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Stories Without Words”.
A schoolboy daydreams in class. In his dream his model airlane becomes real and soars overhead performing breathtaking acrobatic feats.

results.title: The Litterbug
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Productions and Hamilton Luske
results.brief_description: Modern science continues to wage its war on pests of all type. But even science makes little progress against that contemptible pest - the litterbug. Who but Donald Duck should be better suited to portray this scourge of the cities beaches and mountains. With great skill, daring and deep dedication to his task, he methodically deposits his litter for all to see, happy in the realisation that no likely spot has been overlooked.

results.title: The Lion, the witch and the wardrobe
results.creator_credit: BBC, Steven Cuitlahuac Melendez and Bill Melendez
results.brief_description: This is an adventure filled animated tale of two brothers and two sisters who cross through an enchanted wardrobe into the magical world of Narnia, land of talking animals and mythical creatures. They discover that Narnia is under the evil power of the White Witch, who brings eternal winter to the land. It is up to the children to join the noble lion, Aslan, and bring Springtime and happiness back to Narnia.

results.title: The Lion tamer
results.creator_credit: Van Beuren Corporation, Official Films, Amadee J Van Beuren and George Stallings
results.brief_description: Amos (Freeman Gosden) and Andy (Charles Correll) become lion tamers at the circus. With the real lion being too ferocious, Amos and Andy decide to trick the crowd by “taming” a fake lion - a lion costume with two men inside. However, the real lion escapes and unbeknownst to Amos, gets into the cage with him, whilst the fake lion runs away. All hell breaks loose as Amos tries to fend off the hungry lion.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Van Beuren Corporation, Official Films, Amadee J Van Beuren and George Stallings

results.title: The Lion King: Timon and Pumbaa
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Pictures, Tony Craig, Bobs Gannaway, Rob LaDuca, Steve Moore and Jeff DeGrandis
results.brief_description: The Lion King’s lovable pals Timon and Pumbaa enjoy starring roles in their first solo video. Pumbaa is struck by lightning and as a result develops amnesia and has no recollection of his friend Timon and the adventures they have shared. Timon tries his hardest to restore his friends memory, and recalls some of their adventures around the world.

results.title: The Lion King: Simba's Mighty Adventure for Game Boy Color
results.material_description: Cartridge videogame. Cartridge, plastic cartridge case, registration card, consumer information booklet and manual in cardboard box
results.brief_description:
Simba’s Mighty Adventure is based on Disney’s The Lion King as well as it’s direct-to-video sequel Simba’s Pride. The game consists of ten side-scrolling levels: The first six are set in The Lion King and the rest in Simba’s Pride, with some levels ending in boss fights. The game tracks along with the plot of both films and follows Simba as he grows up. Key events, such as the stampede from the first film, make up their own levels. Simba moves by running, jumping and climbing. Jumping can also be used to defeat the snakes, spiders, or monkeys that get in Simba’s way. He can also swipe at them with his claw or, as an adult, roar at them to make them flee.

Aiding Simba in his journey are collectibles that grant extra lives, refill or extend Simba’s health or fill a special amulet. Collecting all five parts of the amulet grants an extra life and opens up a mini-game that can be played main menu. The game also has a mulitplayer element. Using a Gameboy Colour link cable with another player opens up an extramode where each player has to hold onto a star for as long as possible by avoiding the opposing player’s attacks.

results.title: The Lion king
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Pictures, Don Hahn, Roger Allers and Rob Minkoff
results.brief_description: This beautifully animated and wonderfully scored feature film tells the story of the love between a proud lion ruler, Mufasa, and his son, Simba - a naive and curious cub who must find his place in the “circle of life”. Through the help of his friends, and his determination to meet the toughest challenges, Simba eventually takes his place as the rightful ruler of the Pride Lands. His search to meet his destiny puts him face to face in a struggle to the death with his evil uncle Scar and also leads him towards true love. Elton John and Tim Rice’s award winning songs, an excellent score by Hans Zimmer, and voice characterisations by Jeremy Irons, James Earl Jones, Rowan Atkinson, Robert Guillame, Moira Kelly and Matthew Broderick as Simba, make this an unforgettable experience.

constellations_other.name: The drama and nuance of silhouette
constellations_other.description: Ali Gumillya Baker uses silhouette to evocative effect in her work reimagining the colonial gaze. The lighting technique has long been employed by filmmakers for its ability to dramatically convey a wide variety of emotions in everything from film noir to animation and whimsy.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Walt Disney Pictures, Don Hahn, Roger Allers and Rob Minkoff

Through the help of his friends, and his determination to meet the toughest challenges, Simba eventually takes his place as the rightful ruler of the Pride Lands. His search to meet his destiny puts him face to face in a struggle to the death with his evil uncle Scar and also leads him towards true love. Elton John and Tim Rice’s award winning songs, an excellent score by Hans Zimmer, and voice characterisations by Jeremy Irons, James Earl Jones, Rowan Atkinson, Robert Guillame, Moira Kelly and Matthew Broderick as Simba, make this an unforgettable experience.

results.title: The Lion in winter
results.creator_credit: Avco Embassy, Hawarth Product Ltd, Martin Poll and Anthony Harvey
results.brief_description: Based on the play by James Goldman and winner of three Academy Awards. The story of Henry II (Peter O’Toole) and his estranged wife Eleanor of Aquitaine (Katharine Hepburn), is one of the most fascinating in history. Set in Chinon Castle in 12th Century France, the film centres on the royal couple’s remarkable love-hate relationship, which ranges from tender to tempestuous as they connive and cajole to decide which of their three sons will succeed to the English throne.
